intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. penicillatum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features bright yellow flowers arranged in a single, flat-topped inflorescence. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in agricultural and urban environments.
